params.agentCount: number of distinct agents who completed slots
params.claimId: keccak256 of the Convex claim ID string
params.layerCount: number of layers the pipeline ran
params.outputHash: keccak256 of all slot outputs (see convex/registry.ts)

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params.claimId: keccak256 of the Convex claim ID string
params.outputHash: Hash to verify against the committed record

returns._0: true if the hash matches and a record exists

commitPipelineHash(bytes32,bytes32,uint3.notice: Commit the output hash of a completed pipeline.

isCommitted(bytes32).notice: Check whether a pipeline has been committed.

pipelineRecords(bytes32).notice: claimId (keccak256 of Convex ID string) → pipeline record

totalCommitted().notice: Total pipelines committed to this registry

verify(bytes32,bytes32).notice: Verify that a given hash matches the committed record for a claim.

documentation.text: @notice claimId (keccak256 of Convex ID string) → pipeline record
@notice Total pipelines committed to this registry
@notice Check whether a pipeline has been committed.

@title AOPRegistry
 @notice On-chain registry of completed pipeline outputs.
 When an AOP deliberation pipeline completes, the backend hashes all slot
 outputs and commits the root hash here. This establishes tamper-evidence:
 any change to the pipeline outputs in the off-chain database would produce
 a different hash, making manipulation detectable.
 This is Phase 1 of Proof of Intelligence (PoI) — the chain knows pipelines
 happened and what they produced. Phases 2-3 add staking and signed submissions.
 Hash format: keccak256 of the JSON-encoded sorted slot outputs (see convex/registry.ts)
